metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3596 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in ImageMagick in versions prior to 7.0.10-31 in ReadSVGImage() in coders/svg.c. This issue is due to not checking the return value from libxml2's xmlCreatePushParserCtxt() and uses the value directly, which leads to a crash and segmentation fault.

notes.Note: alexmurray> According to debian this only affects imagemagick7 but looking at the code and the patch I suspect the older versions shipped in Ubuntu are also vulnerable. eslerm> only affects creating PS/PDF file which policy.xml forbids (tested)

criterions.comment: imagemagick: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
